metadata.title: CVE-2019-16255 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Ruby through 2.4.7, 2.5.x through 2.5.6, and 2.6.x through 2.6.4 allowscode injection if the first argument (aka the "command" argument) toShell#[] or Shell#test in lib/shell.rb is untrusted data. An attacker canexploit this to call an arbitrary Ruby method.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16255` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.14
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.14
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~ubuntu16.04.14').
jruby: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
